meanings.definition: The state or quality of being capable of producing offspring together.
meanings.sent1: The interfertilities of the two animals allowed them to have babies together.
meanings.sent2: The interfertilities of the plants in the garden ensured a bountiful harvest.
meanings.sent3: The zookeepers were amazed by the interfertilities of the pandas and raccoons.
meanings.sent4: The interfertilities of the bees and butterflies created a buzzing garden symphony.
meanings.sent5: The interfertilities of the fish in the pond made it a lively ecosystem.

meanings.definition: The ability of two different species to interbreed and produce viable offspring.
meanings.sent1: Scientists studied the interfertilities of lions and tigers in the wild.
meanings.sent2: The interfertilities of the horse and donkey resulted in a strong mule.
meanings.sent3: The interfertilities of the birds and squirrels in the park led to some interesting hybrids.
meanings.sent4: The interfertilities of the oak and maple trees symbolized unity in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The interfertilities of the rabbits and hares added diversity to the meadow.
